TopicTitle: Betcha didn't see this in the changelogs for 1.0.4!

Articles.Content: The circular intake got some lovely details added in 1.0.3 or 1.0.4 and now I can't not use it! Thanks Squad for this nice surprise! I have only beauty and data mods installed now (Vens stock revamp isn't one of those)
OOO, i did not notice this! Does it spin when you fly it?

OOO, i did not notice this! Does it spin when you fly it?

I'll check now!

*edit*

no, I'm afraid not

Edited June 24, 2015 by One-Way Films

Ram air intake also got slightly refreshed! It's a bit more pointy, I think.

Actually the shock cone. I mistook the two of those.

Edited June 24, 2015 by Veeltch

I'm still at work.

Just a guess, but those look like inlet vanes, which are often stationary in turbojet engine inlets. These just direct airflow into the axial compressor at the proper angle/speed. The compressor is the part that actually spins.

For instance, the Rolls-Royce Olympus.

Most turbofans have the fan in front. This design is more fuel-efficient than a turbojet, and is found on most modern airliners.

That being said, I have no idea about the part in question in KSP.

Edited June 24, 2015 by DanJourney
I did wonder why the intake didn't have a fan, despite the description referencing to one; It's nice to see it has been added now though.

It was updated in 1.0.3, along with the shock intake. The new MK1 inline cockpit lights up now.

Edited June 24, 2015 by Mad Rocket Scientist
I think the shock cone intake also got changed slightly, with a somewhat bigger cone than before.
Yes, I did notice this, and it looks amazing! I'm going to use these things a lot more from now on
This is great, for reference, the old circular intake looked like it was missing something.

Oh that is nice. I'd not really been using it because;

*snip the old circular intake looked like it was missing something.

I'm glad it no longer looks like a portal to a dark realm!

It was updated in 1.0.3, along with the shock intake. The new MK1 inline cockpit lights up now.

i'd not noticed the lights either!

I find that one of the problems of becoming familiar with parts is not noticing the subtler changes they get after an update. I sometimes really wish I could wipe my KSP brain and go through the discovery of everything all over again.

[...]

i'd not noticed the lights either!

I find that one of the problems of becoming familiar with parts is not noticing the subtler changes they get after an update. I sometimes really wish I could wipe my KSP brain and go through the discovery of everything all over again.

True, I try to right click every part after an update: For example, the parachutes now have a little thing telling you whether it's safe to deploy them.

It is spinning ....

But at a rate adaptive synchronization to your eye to appear standing still no matter the throttle setting.
